intro: Pedicularis dasystachys, commonly known as the broad-stalked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes numerous parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pedicularis dasystachys is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
